title: Pixel 3 USB-C earbuds play sound BUT are not recognized as such ("USB / Charging connected device")
content:
My pixel3 usb-c earbuds stopped working **with Google Assistant** week ago or so. Restarting obviously has no effect... They still play sound and double-clicking the middle button will skip to next song, but I cannot get any Google Assistant features to work (e.g. holding down top button to get time & messages read aloud)... Additionally, in settings>connected devices, the headphones only show up as "USB / Charging connected device" instead of "Pixel USB-C earbuds" as described in the "Set up & use your Pixel USB-C earbuds" help document.

I've already tried using the tip of a very small zip tie to clean/scrape out the inside of the phone's port as well as the earbuds' plug. To the best of my recollection, this started shortly or immediately after I last had to reboot my phone for a system update.  *suspicious*
